column4: i got a 160GB Seagate barracuda, and i want to setup Ubuntu on it! Can someone tell me how to partition most effectively
please note that 1GB of Swap will be on HDD-2. HDD-2 also contains WindowsXP
if you are just using it for general use I would recommend a 40gb / partition and the rest for /home
Root is mainly for programs right?
How much space do those require?
I will be installing programs for Designing (2d animation, 3d animation, vector-pixel based graphic software, audio editing etc)
yeah - root is for programs and stuff and on linux there are many more shared libraries than on windows so the programs tend to be much smaller - you will be fine with 40gb i would think
i think 40gb is too large
Don't you think so?
I mean 40gb of programs!!?
the thing that will take the space is the rendering files as they will be large so you may need the space for /tmp unless you render stuff in /home
that also includes themes and graphics for those programs etc
I would rather have more space than not enough
i wanted to do a 10gb root! What do you say about that?
i have noticed that data expands to fill all space available, so mac space for /home is a top priority
I would go for 20 as base ubuntu takes about 8 i think
would you say <20gb for / is not enough
on my server I have used about 20gb and the same on my laptop accordign to df
i would repeat, Would you say that <20GB for / is not enough? (for designing needs)
i would reccommend 20 gb just so you dont find yourself wanting later
its much easier to add an external hdd for the media rather than having to repartion
on my home pc I have an 80gb disk with 2gb swap, 30gb music (to match my zen) and the rest as root but Im only using 12%
